posts.title: Cooking Salmon
posts.body: Preheat oven to 400Â°F, pat salmon dry and season with salt, pepper and herbs. Bake for 15mins or until salmon is opaque.

posts.title: Fibonacci Sequence
posts.body: The Fibonacci sequence is a sequence in which each element is the sum of the two elements that precede it, the formula is Fn = Fn-1 + Fn-2

posts.title: Functions
posts.body: Functions are self-contained blocks of code that are used to perform specific task/calculations, it can be defined once and called multiple times, making the program more organized and readable.

posts.title: Asynchronous Programming
posts.body: Allowing processes to run independently of the main program flow, rather than waiting for them to complete before proceeding, in Javascript async/await is an example of asyncronous programming.

posts.title: Standard Guitar Tuning
posts.body: A guitar has 6 strings, the standard tuning from lowest string is as follows: EADGBE.

posts.title: keyword: 'const'
posts.body: The 'const' keyword in JavaScript is used to declare a constant variable, meaning its value cannot be reassigned after its initial assignment.

posts.title: Cooking Ravioli
posts.body: Fill pot with water, then bring it to a boil. Add salt and ravioli and cook until ravioli floats to the surface.

posts.title: keyword: 'let'
posts.body: The let keyword in JavaScript declares block-scoped local variables, it provides an alternative to var(function-scoped) with improved scoping rules. It's value can also be altered unlike a 'const' variable.

posts.title: Piano
posts.body: The piano has 88 notes, every 12 notes is considered an octave and a whole rotation around the scale. There are also 12 keys scales in western contempoary music.

posts.title: Pi
posts.body: A mathmatical constant that approximately equal to 3.14159, which is the ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter.
